ygData.subject: Recommended Neural Network Book?

Subject: Recommended Neural Network Book?

Hello all-

I am seeking a recommendation for the equivalent of a neural networks for
dummies book. I have been doing grad research in evolutionary computation
for three and a half years now at MSU on the Avida system. I have worked
with alife and GAs but have not yet done any real work in neural nets. I
would like to use generative representations (e.g. L-systems) to evolve
neural nets for my dissertation, however, so I need to ramp up on neural
nets.  

For the next three weeks I will be in Africa and would like to use any free
time there to learn as much as I can about neural nets. Is there any book
that you recommend I take? I won't have nearly any internet access, and will
often not have my computer, so it would be good if the book does not require
either of those. 

I also think better in sentences than equations, so a book that emphasizes
more of an intuitive logical explanation rather than mathematical
formulation (when possible) would be ideal.

And, of course, I have put off buying this to the last second so I don't
have time to order it online...but do have a Borders nearby and the many
University book shops.

Given all those qualifications, I'm probably out of luck. But I figured if
there was something good out there this group would know of it.

Any recommendations you have would be much appreciated.


Cheers,
Jeff Clune

Digital Evolution Lab
jclune@...
